security: The memorandum details discussions and proposals for clandestine operations against the Castro regime, including potential commando raids, propaganda campaigns, and financial support for anti-Castro groups. Revealing these details could compromise ongoing or future operations, endanger individuals involved, and damage the CIA's reputation.
summary: A dispatch forwarding a memo detailing a meeting between an agency representative and Dr. MIRO Cardona regarding potential anti-Castro operations, including propaganda, commando raids, and establishing a government on Cuban soil.
summary_one_paragraph: This dispatch transmits a memorandum from October 1961, summarizing a meeting with Dr. MIRO Cardona, a key figure in the anti-Castro movement. Cardona outlines proposals for propaganda campaigns targeting Cuba and Cuban exiles, suggests commando actions to weaken the Cuban economy and bolster anti-Castro morale, and requests U.S. support in the form of weapons, funds, and equipment. He also advocates for the Revolutionary Council to establish a government on Cuban soil, requesting immediate U.S. military intervention, further discussing the composition of the Revolutionary Council, his thoughts on the judges, and lawyers and other exile groups.
title: Meeting with Dr. MIRO Cardona on 6 October
